29.verse: Er was the son of Joshua. Joshua was the son of Eliezer. Eliezer was the son of Jorim. Jorim was the son of Matthat. Matthat was the son of Levi.

30.verse: Levi was the son of Simeon. Simeon was the son of Judah. Judah was the son of Joseph. Joseph was the son of Jonam. Jonam was the son of Eliakim.

35.verse: Nahor was the son of Serug. Serug was the son of Reu. Reu was the son of Peleg. Peleg was the son of Eber. Eber was the son of Shelah.

36.verse: Shelah was the son of Cainan. Cainan was the son of Arphaxad. Arphaxad was the son of Shem. Shem was the son of Noah. Noah was the son of Lamech.

37.verse: Lamech was the son of Methuselah. Methuselah was the son of Enoch. Enoch was the son of Jared. Jared was the son of Mahalalel. Mahalalel was the son of Kenan.

38.verse: Kenan was the son of Enosh. Enosh was the son of Seth. Seth was the son of Adam. Adam was the son of God.

1.verse: Jesus Is Tempted by the Devil - Jesus, filled with the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan River. The Spirit led Jesus into the ·desert [wilderness]

He has sent me to ·tell the captives they are free [proclaim liberty/release for the captives/prisoners] and to tell the blind that they can see again [Is. 61:1]. God sent me to free ·those who have been treated unfairly [the oppressed; Is. 58:6]

13.verse: Jesus on the Road to Emmaus - That same day two of Jesus’ followers were going to a town named Emmaus, about seven miles [Greek: sixty stadia; a stadion was about 600 ft.] from Jerusalem.

14.verse: They were talking about everything that had happened.

15.verse: While they were talking and discussing, Jesus himself came near and began walking with them,

16.verse: but ·they [their eyes] were kept from recognizing him.

17.verse: Then he said, “What are these things you are ·talking about [discussing] while you walk?” The two followers stopped, looking ·very sad [downcast].

18.verse: The one named Cleopas answered, “·Are you the only visitor in Jerusalem who does not [or Are you only a visitor in Jerusalem and don’t] know what just happened there?”

19.verse: Jesus said to them, “What ·are you talking about [things]?” They said, “About Jesus of Nazareth. He was a prophet ·who said and did many powerful things [powerful in deed and word] before God and all the people.

20.verse: Our ·leading [chief] priests and ·leaders [rulers] handed him over to be sentenced to death, and they crucified him.

21.verse: But we were hoping that he would ·free [rescue; redeem] Israel. Besides [all] this, it is now the third day since this happened.

22.verse: ·And [But also; Moreover] some women among us ·amazed [astonished] us. Early this morning they went to the tomb,

23.verse: but they did not find his body there. They came and told us that they had seen a vision of angels who said that Jesus was alive!

24.verse: So some of our group went to the tomb, too. They found it just as the women said, but they did not see Jesus.”

25.verse: Then Jesus said to them, “·You are foolish [O foolish ones] and slow [in heart] to believe everything the prophets said.

26.verse: ·They said [Was it not necessary…?] that the ·Christ [Messiah] must suffer these things before he enters his glory.”

27.verse: Then starting with what Moses and all the prophets [a way of referring to the whole Old Testament] had said about him, Jesus began to explain everything that had been written about himself in [all] the Scriptures.

28.verse: They came near the town ·of Emmaus [to which they were going], and Jesus acted as if he were going farther.

29.verse: But they ·begged [urged] him, “Stay with us, because it is late; it is almost night.” So he went in to stay with them.

30.verse: When Jesus ·was at the table [reclined; the posture of a formal meal] with them, he took some bread, ·gave thanks [blessed it], ·divided [broke] it, and gave it to them [Jesus, the guest, functions like the host in a Eucharist-like meal].

31.verse: And then, ·they were allowed to recognize Jesus [their eyes were opened]. But when they saw who he was, he disappeared.

32.verse: They said to each other, “·It felt like a fire burning in [Didn’t our hearts burn within…?] us when Jesus talked to us on the road and ·explained [opened] the Scriptures to us.”

33.verse: So ·the two followers [they] got up ·at once [the same hour] and went back to Jerusalem. There they found ·the eleven apostles [the Eleven] and others gathered.

34.verse: They were saying, “The Lord really has risen from the dead! He showed himself to Simon.”

35.verse: Then ·the two followers [they] told what had happened on the road and how they recognized Jesus when he ·divided [broke] the bread.

36.verse: Jesus Appears to His Followers - While ·the two followers [they] were telling this, Jesus himself stood right in the middle of them and said, “Peace be with you.”

37.verse: They were ·fearful [startled] and terrified and thought they were seeing a ·ghost [spirit].

38.verse: But Jesus said, “Why are you ·troubled [frightened]? Why do ·you doubt what you see [doubts rise in your heart]?

39.verse: Look at my hands and my feet. It is ·I myself [really me]! Touch me and see, because a ·ghost [spirit] does not have ·a living body [flesh and bones] as you see I have.”

40.verse: After Jesus said this, he showed them his hands and feet.

41.verse: While they still could not believe it because they were happy [joyful] and amazed, Jesus said to them, “Do you have any food here?”

42.verse: They gave him a piece of broiled fish.

43.verse: ·While the followers watched [In their presence; In front of them], Jesus took the fish and ate it.

44.verse: He said to them, “·Remember [This is what I said….] when I was with you before? I said that everything written about me must ·happen [be fulfilled]—everything in the law of Moses, the books of the prophets, and the Psalms [a way of referring to the whole Old Testament; see v. 27].”

45.verse: Then Jesus opened their minds so they could understand the Scriptures.

46.verse: He said to them, “It is written that the ·Christ [Messiah] would suffer and rise from the dead on the third day

47.verse: and that ·a change of hearts and lives and [repentance for the] forgiveness of sins would be preached in his name to all nations, starting at Jerusalem.

48.verse: You are witnesses of these things.

49.verse: [And look/behold] I will send you what my Father has promised, but you must stay in ·Jerusalem [the city] until you ·have received [are clothed with] that power from ·heaven [on high].”

50.verse: Jesus Goes Back to Heaven - Jesus led his followers as far as Bethany, and he raised his hands and blessed them.

51.verse: While he was blessing them, he ·was separated [parted] from them and ·carried [taken up] into heaven.

52.verse: They worshiped him and returned to Jerusalem ·very happy [with great joy].

53.verse: They ·stayed in the Temple all the time [were continually in the Temple], praising God.
